ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: We just sat and listened to people speak. It was nice that the talks were so short and the professors were good at giving an overview of what they do.

The course MB&B 675 01 is course where you get to see what the different professors around all the campuses are researching and helps students get ideas as to where they may want to do a lab rotation in. I would recommend this course to another student.

This course provides quick information about the different research that faculty at Yale that are affiliated with BBSB. I would recommend this to all students in the BBSB track because its very important exposure needed to make decisions about your rotations.
That it is an intro to different research options for rotations and that they should definitely attend as they will learn about profs they may not have initially looked at.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It helped me figure out who I want to rotate with.
This course did not necessarily deepen my knowledge of my discipline, but rather gave me ideas as to where I want go for researching in graduate school.
This contributed a lot to choosing my rotations.
This class was helpful for me as I picked my second rotation from these talks and also helped me think about more options for my third.
